intro: Myrcianthes brunnea var. grandifolia, commonly known as the large-fruited myrcianthes, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a small to medium-sized tree belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by edible berries that are orange-red in color. Its botanical significance lies in its potential medicinal properties and role in local ecosystems.
